direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are part of the PseudoTcpNotify interface and handle state changes related to TCP socket readability and writability.
Both methods handle state changes and may propagate exceptions, similar in their handling of TCP state transitions.
Both methods involve operations related to reading and writing data packets, handling similar resources (TCP socket).
Both methods involve handling packets and updating the state of the PseudoTCPBase instance, sharing similar control flow and data handling.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require initialization of state before performing operations, though for different purposes.
Environment setup is required before handling TCP readable events, ensuring the environment is ready for network operations.
Both methods verify formats and handle similar exceptions, providing a basis for assertions on the state of the TCP socket.
